page.title: 11 WELLINGBOROUGH SCHOOL
page.content: To the visitor, two things are quickly apparent in Wellingborough School. It is old and it is homely. It is homely in the English sense, that is warm, welcoming and comfortable. Those who accept its standards and conform to its rules fit into it after a short while as the foot into a well-worn shoe. It is old both in appearance and style. There is a sense of purpose about its community as if the members know what they are doing and why. It has all been done before many times by well-tested and proven methods. Change there must be, but it comes slowly. The self-confidence both of age, maturity and long tradition is best seen on the gracious and generous playing fields. Here one can read four generations of pupils' names inscribed on the pavilion benches. Here, the timeless drama of cricket games
